New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit the fastest pitch recorded in MLB history
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a home run to seal his 47th of the season
Tommy Edman, Will Smith and Max Muncy hit back-to-back-to-back homers off Chicago starter Jordan Wicks
Shohei Ohtani swiped his 48th base of the season
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani is on pace for 52 homers and 53 steals by the end of the regular season
Shohei Ohtani has already made plenty of history with the Dodgers
Shohei Ohtani set records for both size of contract and deferred contract money when he signed with the Dodgers before this season
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers won 10-8 against the Chicago Cubs
Shohei Ohtani added another single in the third inning but with no stolen bases
Shohei Ohtani's current home run count surpasses his previous career high of 46 set in 2021
Shohei Ohtani currently leads the NL in homers and ranks behind only Elly De La Cruz in steals
